climbs.name: Kind of Nice
climbs.fa: Trent Hillier and Sarah Howe, October 30, 2020

content.description: Begin starting below the obvious, right-facing corner near the left end of the wall kind of facing the road. Move up the corner, following solid flakes, good gear placements, and a few spots where gardening is needed. Most of the route remains within the 5.6/7 threshold, with one mantel move that may feel insecure for some. Scrape the lichen off of your shoes, make a gear anchor, belay up your second, and walk off.
content.protection: Small fingers 0.1-0.5 and a #2 Camalot, a gear anchor, and walk off.
content.location: Walk to the portion of the wall semi-facing County Rd. 371. It is the obvious corner on the left hand side. This is very hard to miss.
